answers.answer: It's to help the babies lungs. I got it at 30 weeks because I went into labor. Now we check for practice breathing every week and yesterday he wouldn't stop. Lol. But it's just a precaution. If your doctor says get it then get it.
I got them when I was pregnant with DS as I had placenta previa. I was 34w.  He was born exactly 37w, and was absolutely fine.

Incidentally I just had a quick search online and I couldn't find anything suggesting it was unsafe after 32 weeks.  They are normally given between 28-34 weeks because after 34 weeks the babies lungs are going to be fairly well developed anyway, in which case the steriods won't really make much difference - but it's not actually harmful.
Thank you all for your answers! I'll be going to hospital this Sunday to get the shots
